channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2023080037
item.description:
Report E-2023080037

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: DUBAI UAE
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING PACKAGE X-RAY AT THE UPS FACILITY IN DUBAI, UNITED ARAB EMIRATES, THREE X 50 ML AND ONE X 100 ML FLAMMABLE PERFUMERY PRODUCTS WERE DISCOVERED. THERE ARE ALSO NUMEROUS ONE AND TWO ML SAMPLE PERFUMERY PRODUCTS IN THE SHIPMENT. INVOICE AND THERMAL TRACKING LABEL DESCRIPTION IS GROOMING OIL SAMPLE SET. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report E-2023080029
item.description:
Report E-2023080029

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During loading there was no signs of product leaking. Driver moved to the customer scale on site and noticed the turpentine smell and then saw a leak coming from the bottom forward section of the insulation through a weep hole. Driver moved it to the customer containment area on site. We formulated a game plan with the shipper to transfer it in to a new trailer. We also brought in a response team to 'diaper' the trailer in the interim to help contain it. The transload was successful and the trailer stopped leaking and was cleaned and put on the train back to Chicago.

item.title: Report X-2023080633
item.description:
Report X-2023080633

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFIED PERSONNEL CALLED ABOUT A WET DISTRESSED PACKAGE. BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE. DescribePack: INSUFFICIENT INNER PACKING ALLOWING MOVEMENT THIS ALLOWED CAP TO BECOME CRACKED AND LIQUID RELEASE TO OCCUR. BOX WAS UNDECLARED NO DIAMOND LABELS, UP ARROWS, HAZMAT SERVICE CODE OR ANY HAZMAT DOCUMENTATION. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: WET BOX AND PRODUCT WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE AND TAKEN TO HMPA FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023080119
item.description:
Report X-2023080119

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFICATED PERSONNEL INFORMED OF DISTRESSED PACKAGE. SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW, NOTED LIQUID RELEASE CONTAINED TO PACKAGE. DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: LID HAD DENT ON SIDE ALLOWING LID TO LOOSEN ALLOWING SPILLAGE DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: DRUM WAS PLACED UPRIGHT TO MITIGATE SPILLAGE

item.title: Report X-2023070524
item.description:
Report X-2023070524

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: IRVING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 18th during the AM sort, a package opened and among the other personal affects inside there was also six boxes of ammunition discovered. There are no markings on the outside of the package indicating any ammunition is in the package. The package is being held pending FAA investigation.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: Four drums of Morpholine (UN2054) were the only cargo left during the unloading process of a trailer. An odor was detected, therefore, a contractor was requested on site for further assessment of the situation. It was discovered that two of the four drums had potentially released approximately one-gallon of product onto the trailer floor throughout transit. The cause is likely corrosion identified at the bottom of the two drums. The drums were overpacked by the contractor.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS BEING LOOKED AT AND INVESTIGATED ON WHETHER IT NEEDED TO BE RTS OR SENT ON TO CUSTOMER. LOOKED TO VERIFY IF THE HAZMAT CERT WAS ON FILE SINCE PRIOR SCANS SHOWED IT WAS SENT BACK TO THE SHIPPER ONCE ALREADY. WHEN PKG WAS PICKED UP OFF THE GROUND, THE BOTTOM FELL OUT AND 3 BOTTLES BUSTED. THE DIRT WAS PUT OVER THE LIQUID TO KEEP IT CONTAINED AND PKG WAS SECURED. GLASS WAS SWEPT UP AND PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG ALONG WITH THE REST OF THE PKG. DescribePack: BOX WAS WET ON THE BOTTOM AND EMPLOYEE WHO LIFTED THE PKG WAS UNAWARE OF THAT. BOX FELL APART. CONTENTS FELL OUT OF THE BOTTOM. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: DIRT WAS PUT OVER THE LIQUID TO ABSORB AND THE GLASS WAS SWEPT UP AND PUT IN THE HAZMAT BAG WITH THE REST OF THE PKG

  • Description: On July 14, 2023, one (1) 48-pound box of HA powder (UN3262) was forked and released one (1) pound of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. LSH neutralized the released material and utilized absorbents to collect the spent product. All clean up debris and the damaged box were contained in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The drum was labeled and staged onsite for profiling and disposal by R+L personnel.

  • City: NEENAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 13, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of a corrosive liquid (UN2922) and one (1) 5-gallon pail of sodium hydroxide (UN1824) were damaged by a forklift and released approximately nine (9) gallons of the two products to the trailer interior and pavement underneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Valley Environmental Response (VER) to remediate the impacted site. VER personnel deployed absorbents and a neutralizing agent to remediate the site. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into three (3) cubic yard boxes. The impacted pallets were collected and containerized into one (1) cubic yard box. The two (2) damaged pails were collected and containerized into two (2) overpack drums. All containers were staged onsite for disposal by R+L

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 13, 2023, two (2) 5-liter metal cans of UN1263 were crushed during transit and released approximately one quarter (.25) gallon of product to the pallet in the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HCE personnel downstacked the pallet to find two (2) leaking cans of product. Crews wiped down the impacted freight with universal absorbent pads, and then they staged the remediated freight for further shipment and processing. The leaking cans and miscellaneous cleanup debris were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum that was staged in the terminal's waste holding room. Crews took the impacted pallet back to their shop for reuse.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAQ experienced a UN3105 NOROX MEKP-9 release from boxes containing (4) 1-quart poly bottles. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-gallons of product released to a 6' x 4' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. A total of (24) 1-quart poly bottles were found damaged and placed into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. Absorbents and sodium bicarb were used to clean the impacted area and then collected along with all impacted cardboard into an additional (3) 55-gallon vented poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023080226
item.description:
Report X-2023080226

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: SALEM
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Contents was brought to QA, upon inspection, opening the content in a repack FedEx box. there were 4 jugs of Just Right Heavy Duty Degreaser. 3 of the 4 jugs were in large ziploc bags, the 4th jug was not. Upon further inspection, a team member noticed that there was a slow leak on the bottom of 1 of the jugs, possibly punctured during transit. Before finding out it was a possible LQ, there were no labels indicating that it was Corrosive liquid or a hazmat on the repack box. DescribePack: The contents were originally packed in one large trash bag and inside was four individual plastic bags. the one that was punctured was no contained in a bag. the puncture was located at the bottom of the jug missing the product label. There was not much protection between the box and the jugs. They appeared to be just double bagged. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Contents was inspected, attempt to mitigate further leakage, by adding absorbent sheets on the bottom of the leaking jug, until dealt with properly.

item.title: Report X-2023080212
item.description:
Report X-2023080212

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: MESQUITE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080212 SequenceEvent: Package was removed from the IC conveyor belt onto the IC rollers in preparation for loading. The rollers did not have a stop/catch at the end so the bucket rolled off onto the floor and the lid popped loose, causing it to spill. The bucket was returned to an upright position and QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were laid down to prevent to any injuries. DescribePack: The bucket was dropped onto its side and the lid popped open. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bucket was returned to an upright position and QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were laid down to prevent to any injuries. 2. X-2023080214 SequenceEvent: Package was removed from the IC conveyor belt onto the IC rollers in preparation for loading. The IC rollers did not have a stop/catch at the end and so the package rolled off onto the floor which popped the lid loose and caused it to leak. The bucket was turned back to an upright position to prevent further leaking and QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and brought back to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The package dropped from the IC rollers onto the floor which caused the lid to come loose and start leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bucket was turned back to an upright position to prevent further leaking and QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and brought back to the hazmat cage.

  • Description: A fiberboard box containing a class 8 was found in the Memphis dangerous goods building with signs of release. While investigating the package the spill agent discovered that one of the six glass bottles had a small crack on the bottom. The bottles were packaged in molded Styrofoam mold top and bottom. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Description: On 07/13/2023 at aprroximatley 1255, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 3989104 at the ramp faclity in Mirabel, reporting an undeclared matches shipment. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing several packets of safety matches. The shipment was discovered due to an insecure closure. The outer package was resused and worn and the tape failed keep the package closed. The package was prepared in accordance with the required marking, labeling, packaging, and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an investigation in the Canadian regulatory entity.

  • Description: On 7/11/2023 at approximately 1525, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 780470 at international hub in Köln, Germany, reporting a flammable liquid spill. The shipment consisted of 8 fiberboad boxes, each with one metal can inside. One of the shipments was discovered to have leaked onto one other shipment. The cause of the spillage was undetermined. German policy on spills requires a call to the fire brigade, who then took possession of the both the leaking package and the affected pakcage.

  • Description: On 07/3/2023 at approximately 2220, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5006446 at the hub facility in Memphs, reporting a flammable spill. The shipment consisted of 8 fiberboard boxes, each containing 1 metal can. Two of the packages appeared wet on the bottom. Further inspection revealed the closure of the metal can were compromised. The cause of the damage is unknown. The spillage has been contained and the undamaged pieces were placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2023070316
item.description:
Report X-2023070316

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: SUMTER
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A SEVEN PIECE SHIPMENT FROM SC TO HONG KONG WAS STOPPED FOR INVOICE INSPECTION AT THE UPS ORIGIN FACILITY IN SUMTER, SC WHEN SMOKE WAS NOTICED RELEASING FROM ONE OF THE BOXES. THE RESPONDER OPENED THE PACKAGE TO FIND LCD SCREENS FOR VARIOUS ELECTRONIC DEVICES. THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT RESPONDED AND ISOLATED THE WARM/SMOKING ITEMS WITH A TEMPERATURE GUN. SEVERAL LITHIUM ION BATTERIES WERE DISCOVERED STILL ATTACHED TO SOME OF THE LCD SCREENS. THE BATTERIES WERE CHARRED AND MELTED INDICATIVE OF A THERMAL EVENT. THE OUTER BOX SHOWS NO VISIBLE SIGNS OF A THERMAL EVENT. THE LCD SCREENS WITH ATTACHED BATTERIES INVOLVED IN THE THERMAL EVENT WERE ISOLATED AND ARE BEING HELD IN A SALVAGE DRUM FOR FAA INSPECTION. THE ADDITIONAL SIX BOXES WERE NOT OBSERVED TO CONTAIN ANY BATTERIES BUT ARE BEING HELD. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM SC USING UPS ACCOUNT 898FV2, TOPYET ELECTRONIC CO, UNIT 10/F BLK 03, KWUN TONG, HONG KONG. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA Hazmat cage. During inspection it was found that the cap on the 5- gallon jug had failed to oporate. After the inspection was complete all contents within the package and jug were placed into a 20-gallon salvage drum to prevent vaper and liquid from causing further damage. DescribePack: The failure was caused by the cap failing to operate. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I attempted to tighten the jug but failed to do so as the cap was night airtight, and you could hear air escaping the closure. Package and all contents were placed into a hazmat bag tightened closed and placed into a 20-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2023080068
item.description:
Report X-2023080068

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: NEW HAVEN
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA ALERTED TO LEAKING HAZMAT AROUND 5 AM. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION, PACKAGE WAS PREVIOUSLY RTS'D DUE TO BEING AN IMPROPER HAZMAT. PACKAGE WAS NOT SHIPPED AS A HAZMAT AS IT SHOULD HAVE BEEN. NO DOT LABELS OTHER THAN THE STANDARD DIAMOND LABEL. NO HAZMAT PAPERWORK PROVIDED EITHER. THE PACKAGE HAD WENT OVERHEAD, AND SPILLED IN THE CHUTE AND ON THE FLOOR, APPROX. 2 CUPS OF LIQUID RESIN SPILLED. PACKAGE CONTAINED 2 METAL CANS OF PRIMER RESIN (APPROX 3.75 GAL OF RESIN TOTAL), NEITHER CAN HAD CLIPS TO SECURE THE LIDS. CLEANUP INCLUDED GLOVES AND ABSORBENT PADS. PACKAGE TAKEN AWAY FROM WORK AREA AND SET IN FRONT OF QA CAGE TO BE WORKED. DescribePack: 2 CANS NO CLIPS. 1 LID HAD BECOME LOOSE, LEAKING CONTENTS. BOTH CANS HAD ALSO BEEN DENTED NEAR THE LID. ONE CAN HAD A SMALL DENT, OTHER HAD A MEDIUM DENT DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY SET ABSORBENT PADS ON THE SPILLED LIQUID TO PREVENT SLIPPAGE. PACKAGE TAKEN AWAY FROM WORK AREA TO PREVENT INHALATION

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: TOLEDO

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to failure of the container cap from one (1) 5-gallon plastic jug. Enviroserve personnel removed all freight from the pallet to verify that one jug was impacted. Enviroserve personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted trailer floor. The spent material was recovered and containerized into one 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged plastic jugs were placed into one (1) additional 55-gallon poly drum. The non-damaged freight was restacked onto a pallet and shipped on to the consignee. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: While unloading a trailer at Veolia 10 day intransit facility in Henderson, CO, Veolia operators discovered that the load had shifted during transportation.   • Description: On July 24, 2023 at 1305 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Tulare, California regarding the release of approximately (1) pound of AZTEC 4.67G (UN2783, 6.1 III) from (1) plastic tote. The release was reportedly due to the cap being loose and popping off during load shift, and was contained to the inside of the trailer only. The release was cleaned up with the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon metal drum and was taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Veolia employee were loading the IBC onto a trailer at the 10 day intransit facility in Menomonee Falls, WI when a leak was identified as coming from the bottom valve of the container. Upon further inspection, the valve completely snapped off resulting in a release of approximately 25 gallons of material onto the trailer floor and to the pavement beneath the trailer. The spill was quickly cleaned up and the remaining material in the IBC was transferred into a 55 gallon drum. The NRC was notified to report the release of a D003 material that exceed the RQ limit of 100 lbs.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: DARDANELLE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 13, 2023, one (1) 125-gallon tote of UN2428 was damaged due to improper bracing during transit and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the gravel, trailer, and soil. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted surfaces. Crews deployed poly sheeting to the impacted area and diluted the product with water. E3 personnel transferred the contents of the tote using a gravity transfer into a new tote. The tote was properly label and repalletized for continued processing and shipping. Crews utilized absorbent pads to remove residual products and insure cleaning of the impacted cargo .A pressure washer was used to clean the outside of the trailer. All spent absorbents and impacted tote were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal

  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 13, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2922 was punctured and released approximately fifty (50) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Environmental (AE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. AE personnel deployed granular absorbent to the concrete and worked them in with hand tools, utilizing a degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. Once all free product was collected, crews utilized a power washer to further remediate the surface and collected the rinsate in a vac-truck. All methylene chloride impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and transported to the RLC terminal to be added to the facility waste stream.

  • Description: On July 21, 2023, at 1620 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Rancho Cucamonga, California regarding the release of approximately (1) cup of Sodium Hydroxide (UN1824, 8, II) from (1) 275-gallon IBC tote. Upon arrival contractors reported the release was due to a loose lid. Contractors cleaned up the release with the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 5-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023070936
item.description:
Report E-2023070936

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 12, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3264 was punctured by a nail and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer floor and wood pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. Crews applied a patch to the damaged 5-gallon pail to contain the remaining product for disposal purposes. The impacted pallet was dismantled with a sawzall for disposal. Absorbent pads and cleaners were used to remove any residual product from the impacted surfaces. The dismantled pallet and all UN3264-impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal. The one (1) damaged pail was collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPH experienced a UN3105 NOROX MEKP-900 release from 8 boxes each containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released impacting their boxes and dock floor in a 3' x 3' due to loose lids on the jugs. A total of 32 bottles were found damaged and containerized into a 30-gallon and 55-gallon vented poly drums. Absorbent pads were utilized to clean the released product. The impacted rags, cardboard, and cleanup debris were then placed into a separate 55-gallon vented poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. However, it was reported no liquid product was visible and whatever leaked from the trailer was burned by the fire. No waste was generated from this release.

UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EIGHT INNER BOXES MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1170 ETHANOL SOLUTION WITH CLASS 3 FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND LABELS AND AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. EACH OF THOSE EIGHT INNER BOXES CONTAINED 10 X 100 ML (3.4 OZ) BOTTLES OF FLAMMABLE EPIDIOLEX SOLUTION. THE TOTAL AMOUNT FOR THE ENTIRE SHIPMENT WAS 8000 ML (271 OZ). THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTERMOST BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2023070400
item.description:
Report X-2023070400

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET/STAINED IN APPEARANCE BY THE CENTER CLERK AT THE WEST COUNTY BOXLINE-2 STATION. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 4 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 PLASTIC 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE SIDE WALLS AND BASE OF THE CARTON. THE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF CORRUGATED FIBERBOARD PARTITIONS AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST.

  • Description: SUPERVISOR CALLED THE DESIGNATED RESPONDERS. RESPONDER ARRIVED AT THE AREA, UTILIZED DECISIN TREE/RESPONSE SHEETS TO ASSESS THE SITUATION. RESPONDER CONTAINERIZED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY. RESPONDER USED SODIUM BICARBONATE ZEP ZORBENT TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL, SWEPT UP ALL CONTAMINATED ABSORBENT, PUT IT INTO ANOTHER LINED SPILL TRAY. RESPONDER THEN TOOK THE PACKAGE TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. WHEN RESPONDER OPENED THE BOX, FOUND THAT 1 GLASS BOTTLE WAS BROKEN HAD SOILED THE REMAINING BOTTLES.

PACKAGE TRACKING NUMBER 1Z4499070201205648 CONTAINS FOUR STRYKER PHOTONBLADE ELECTROSURGICAL INSTRUMENTS. PACKAGE TRACKING NUMBER 1Z4499070201205657 CONTAINS ONE STRYKER PHOTONBLADE ELECTROSURGICAL INSTRUMENT. EACH SURGICAL DEVICE CONTAINS ONE CR123A 3V LITHIUM METAL BATTERY IN THE EQUIPMENT. THERE IS NO LITHIUM BATTERY MARK APPLIED TO EACH BOX AS REQUIRED PER THE REQUIREMENTS OF IATA PI 967, SECTION II. THERE IS A PACKING LIST INSIDE EACH BOX WHICH INDICATES THE CONTENTS ARE HAZMAT. THE OUTER BOXES ARE PREPRINTED OVERPACK. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: On 7/8/2023 at approximately 1100, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 658069 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a paint spill from a multiple-piece shipment. The shipment consisted of 3 fiberboard boxes, each containing metal cans of paint. Two of the three pieces were compromised. The master shipment, ending in -5585, contained 4 cans of paint and the shipment ending in -5600 containing 2 cans paint. The master package had minor spillage the cause was unknown. One of the metal cans completely from the shipment ending in -5600, due to body structure failing. The remainder of both shipments wer placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • Description: THE LEAKING PACKAGE WAS RESPONDED TO IN WEST PRIMARY AND RETURNED TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING. RESPONDER DISCOVERED THAT THE INNER BOXES WITHIN THE PACKAGE WERE LABELLED WITH LIMITED QUANTITY HAZMAT DIAMONDS, BUT NO CORRESPONDING HAZMAT DIAMOND WAS AFFIXED TO THE OUTER CARTON (NOR WERE THERE ANY OUTWARD INDICATIONS OF THE PACKAGE CONTENTS). SECTION 14 OF THE SDS FOR THE PRODUCT (MOPAR LIMITED SLIP ADDITIVE) LISTED THE PROUCT AS UN1760, CORROSIVE LIQUIDS, N.O.S., 8, II. RMP WAS NOTIFIED OF THE PACKAGE AND CONTACTED THE HMSC TO REPORT THE INCIDENT. PACKAGE IS BEING HELD FOR ADG COMPLIANCE. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER: 1ZB370310308714308

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Came off trailer #838446 already wet leaking and damaged. Package handler Gage Ettinger was lifting the box unaware that the package was wet and leaking, got on his shin of leg. Manager was notified took steps for first aid. Package handler is fine. Upon inspecting the inner contents there were 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of Artic Ice Machine Cleaner. The 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .70 gallons to release. A corrugated liner was used in box to separate the bottles in box. No other absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed, contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle of Artic Ice Machine Cleaner had a loose cap allowing .70 gallons to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the leaking package and was taken to the hazmat cage for further inspection of box.

item.title: Report X-2023071215
item.description:
Report X-2023071215

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: NASH admin discovered a leaking fiberboard box on the flexslide. Admin did not initially suspect this was a hazardous material as there were no diamond labels or hazmat paperwork attached to the packaging. Gloves were donned and package with all absorbed spillage was placed in a double-lined tote/bin and transported to the HMPA for further investigation. Pictures of the original packaging were found on Spidr. The shipper TRU VALUE/PROMAX could not verify the presence of a hazmat or whether content was (as stated on original packaging) six 1 gallon plastic bottles of Rooto 10% Ammonia; their SDS service through Ambipar could not provide any details of Section 14 of the SDS provided. In the shipper's SDS Section 14, all descriptors (except for PG: III) were listed as NA. The manufacturer Rooto Corp provided admin with an SDS Section 14 that described the material as UN2672, Ammonia solution, 8 III. PGH was kept informed of all developments. As the shipper could not verify content or presence of a hazmat, ERTS was called to verify the material and transfer all spillage to a drum. Constant ventilation was provided during this process. DescribePack: One of six 1gal bottles lost 0.7 gallon due to a loose cap closure. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: PPE was donned. The package and all spillage was placed in a double-lined, lidded tote and moved under ventilation for further investigation. As the shipper could not verify content or presence of a hazmat, ERTS was called to verify the material and transfer all spillage to a drum. Constant ventilation was provided during this process.

  • Description: 1. X-2023071184 SequenceEvent: The cap on one of the bottles came loose and an internal leakage occurred. Upon being discovered, the item was brought to QA to be worked on. DescribePack: The contents were protruding from one side. When the box was opened, it was determined that a bottle with a loose cap was the cause. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The contents were brought to QA and placed into a spill tote. 2. X-2023071188 SequenceEvent: CAPS ON NU-BRITE CONDENSER COIL CLEANER CAME LOOSE AT SOME POINT DURING TRANSIT CAUSING INTERNAL LIQUID CONTENTS TO LEAK THROUGHOUT PKG. PKG WAS BROUGHT TO QA FOR PROCESSING. DescribePack: CAPS CAME LOOSE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS PLACED IN A SPILL TOTE AND BROUGHT TO QA. 3. X-2023071189 SequenceEvent: Cap on bottle came loose and an internal leakage resulted. Upon being discovered, the item was brought to QA to be worked on. DescribePack: Contents were protruding from box due to their corrosive nature DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Item was placed in a spill tote to minimize spillage. 4. X-2023071192 SequenceEvent: There was a crack near the base of the lid on one of the bottles which caused the corrosive liquid to spill out into the box. DescribePack: The package failure was a crack in the neck of the bottle near the base of the lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the dpr, hess report, and isf will be completed and will wait for disposition for further instructions.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the package in a red hazardous material bin. I did not see any visible damage to the box. There was a strong odor coming from the box. I grabbed my PPE to inspect the box. There weren't any wet spots inside of the box. The bottles were packed in individual zip lock bags with absorbents inside separated by corrugated liners inside a big plastic bag. DescribePack: Three bottles' cap were barely on the bottle. Noticed there is a size difference of the bottle opening and the cap. The only thing that were keeping the caps on the bottles were black tape. The gasoline from each bottle spilled into the zip lock bag of absorbent. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Kept the bottle upright and placed into a drum to control the odor.

item.title: Report E-2023070903
item.description:
Report E-2023070903

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 13, 2023, one (1) 446-gallon tote containing isopropanol experienced a faulty valve and released approximately one-half (.5) gallon of product to the concrete. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to remediate the impacted surface. Crews utilized absorbent pads to remove residual products and insure cleaning of the impacted tote. Poly sheeting was placed around the tote as a precautionary measure. Upon further inspection of the value it was determined that a part would need to be order to repair the tote. Crews transferred the contents of the tote into nine (9) 55-gallon drums to be collected the following day. All spent absorbents, damaged pails, and impacted cardboard box were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly bag for transport and disposal. After receiving approval from on-site RLC representative, Mr. Eric Tisdale, MEG crews secured the site and scheduled their return at a later date to replace the valve and transfer the contents of the tote.

item.title: Report E-2023070901
item.description:
Report E-2023070901

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: JERSEY CITY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 12, 2023, one (1) 1-gallon jug of UN3149 was damaged during transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the surrounding cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to remediate the impacted surfaces. MEG personnel noted one (1) empty gallon of UN3149 with residual material released to the surrounding cargo. The crew deployed absorbents to the release and utilized hand tools to collect all UN3149-impacted materials into two (2) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal. MEG personnel noted that no further actions were required on site and crews demobilized.

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-16
  • City: FLORENCE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/16/2023, at 1720 hours, personnel in the CSX Florence Yard (Florence, SC) discovered DAKX 29917, a loaded tank car of Ethylene Glycol, leaking from top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Sabic, was notified (CHEMTREC Report 2023-0716-00035). HEPACO, a CSXT response contractor, responded and found liquid product to be leaking between the liquid line valve mounting flange and the car’s pressure plate. Contractor personnel vented the car’s pressure to stop the release. The issue identified and containment measures were communicated to Sabic’s representative- Greg Horton (Greg.Horton2@Sabic.com, 812-305-2295). The car was held at the CSX Florence Yard pending additional repair and qualification or OTMA.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOAD SUPERVISOR RADIOED INTO DMP WITH A HAZMAT LEAKER. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER TO THE LEAKER WITH FULL PPE AND FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED AND CONSULTED THE DECISON TREE TO FIND THE APPROIATE RESPONES STEPS. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE, THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL AND BROUGHT THE LEAKER BACK TO DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL OF THE HAZMAT.

item.title: Report X-2023070285
item.description:
Report X-2023070285

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DMP RECIEVED A CALL FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE FLOOR ON THE PD8 FROM THE DOCK SUPERVISOR WHICH WAS DISCOVERED BY THE PICKOFF. THE BELT WAS SHUT OFF AND SUCURED AND THE AREA WAS EVACUATED. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER DONNING THE CORRECT PPE RESPONDED TO THE AREA WITHIN 5 MINUTES AND USING THE DECISION TREE, IDENTIFIED THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND CONTAINED IT. THE OUTER CARTON OF THE PACKAGE WAS VISIBLY STAINED ON THE BOTTOM AND THE SIDES BUT NOT LEAKING OUTSIDE ONTO THE SURROUNDING AREA. THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP FOR PROCESSING AND FURTHER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT ONE OF THE INNER BLADDERS WAS PUNCTURED AND HAD LEAKED APPROXIMATELY 12 OUNCES.

item.title: Report I-2023070025
item.description:
Report I-2023070025

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-09
  • City: Dayton
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAST PENN LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The driver picked up a load of Industrial Motive Power Batteries from a customer in Dayton, NJ. The batteries looked to be secured to the pallets and the pallets looked to be in good, sturdy condition. The driver traveled about 2 miles down the road to a stop light. While pulling away from the light he heard a bang coming from his trailer. He pulled over as soon as he found a safe place to do so along a ramp going onto the Turnpike. When he opened the trailer to check the load he saw that one of the batteries had fallen over due to a pallet collapsing. THere was no harsh braking, acceleration or cornering events to trigger the spill. He then checked the rest of the load and saw that there were other pallets that were not looking as stable as they should be. The driver did have some soda ash on his truck which he used to soak up, neutralize and berm as much of the spilled acid as he could. He did call back to Corporate for help with the clean up. The police showed up to the scene. After assessing the spill and seeing that the trailer is no longer leaking the police assisted the driver to tum his truck around and off the Turnpike ramp for easier assistance for clean up. The Hazmat clean up team arrived shorlty after the turnaround. While wating for the Hazmat clean up team, the driver contacted the cutomer that he picked up the batteries from since they were a few miles down the road asking if they would take back his load and help up-right the battery that had spilled. They accepted. The police gave the driver permission to drive back to the custmer with the Hazmat clean up team following to make sure that nothing leaked from the trailer during transit. Nothing leaked during the move. The police informed the driver that they will have the trunpike maintenacne clean up the spilled area on the ramp. Once back at the cusomer, the customer unloaded the load and helped to up-right the spilled battery. They are going to re-palletize ALL the batteries and put them on better/ stronger pallets for a future pick up. The Hazmat team cleaned out the trailer and will take care of the clean up waste. Once the trailer was cleaned the driver returned home with an

item.title: Report X-2023070336
item.description:
Report X-2023070336

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: DOTHAN
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023070336, X-2023070459: Package was offered to the spill clean up specialist at our station location in Dothan, AL. Discovered during AM sort operations, package was seen to wet on outside of fibreboard box indicating leakage from inside. Further inspection found that package contained 4 plastic jugs each containing 3.78L of Alligare Diquat Herbicide (UN 1760) placed in a Surge Broadleaf Herbicide for turf box, UN 3082. Each set of 2 jugs was placed in a plastic moisture barrier before being placed in the box. It was seen leakage originated from the caps of the bottles and is believed to have been caused by expansion due to local heat. SDS of Surge Broardleaf Herbicide shows commodity could travel under special provision A197. However, the SDS also shows product has a flash point of 57 C and a boiling point of 100 C. Flammable, packing group III. There are no marks nor labels on the package indicating the product being shipped was flammable. SDS for Alligare Diquat shows commodity would be classified as UN1760 Corrosive Liquid, N.O.S (contains diquat dibromide) There were no marks nor labels to indicate a corrosive product was being transported. Package was contained at location and is awaiting FAA disposition.

item.title: Report E-2023070963
item.description:
Report E-2023070963

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-02
  • City: STONE MOUNTAIN
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: METRO PETRO LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The truck and trailer were traveling East in US 78 in Stone Mountain GA. The driver then took the W Park Pl Blvd exit and proceeded to turn right onto W Park Pl Blvd. There is a traffic light at the intersection and the driver had the green light. As the driver was completing the turn, he felt the trailer shift and when he checked in his mirrors, he observed the trailer rolling over. The truck did not attempt to roll over and he was able to pull the truck over to the side of the road and stop. The trailer rolled onto the lift side then top and the right side landed on top of a car waiting at the traffic signal which was red. There was another car in front of the car it landed on and it struck the rear of the car which was later driven from the scene buy the occupants. The seam split on the lower left of the tank which did not leak because of the final resting position of the tank, it was at the top above the level of the fuel. The crack was a direct result of the rollover. The crack was later enlarged to facilitate the removal of the fuel from that compartment. The rear most top inspection hatch was leaking and the fire department added an additional clamp to the lid to slow the leak and they put a containment pool under the lid to catch the leaking fuel. The bulkheads between compartments 4, and 5 the comp internally ruptured into the void. Holes were then drilled into the side of the trailer which were facing up and the majority of the fuel was pumped from the trailer while it was on it's side. The trailer was the righted and the remaining fuel was pumped from the load heads on the bottom of trailer. The fire department made a small earthen dam to stop the flow of fuel from the small leaks while we were waiting for the Hazmat cleanup companies to arrive. They then use absorbent material and booms to catch and contain the small leaks.

  • City: OCALA

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was found and offered to the dangerous goods specialist at our Ocala Fl station location during morning sort. Package was a plastic pak and employee could hear what they describe as a metal ball rattling. They believed the package could contain an aerosol can inside. Package was opened for inspection and a spray can of Alu-Mend was found inside. Label on can claimed contents to be flammable and under pressure. There were no DG marks nor labels to indicate package contained an aerosol. Package has been held at station location pending FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023070251
item.description:
Report X-2023070251

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-16
  • City: NEW YORK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was found brough to the attention of the spill specialist at one of our station locations in New York, NY. Part of a multi piece shipment, package was emitting a strong odor, however, a smudge of what looked like grey-green paint was seen on yellow tape on box. Package was opened at the request of Dangerous Goods Administration, and it was seen a green paint like substance had leaked in the package. Package was reported to contain a metal can which was bent and release an estimated 2 KG (L) of product. Bubble wrap was used to wrap the can and as dunnage. Originating in Hong Kong Paperwork traveling with the package indicated the package contained a waterproof coating which should have been milky white in color. However, the can inside stated the contents were "Xincaihong Special Ink" and was not the color the SDS indicated. Package was placed in a steel salvage drum and has been held at the station location pending FAA investigation.

  • Description: On July 3, 2023, at 1212 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Ranger personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (5) gallon of IMEP-SAS 2011 (Flammable liquid, n.o.s., (Methanol), UN1993, 3, III) from (1) 275-gallon plastic tote due to load shift. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release impacted the whole trailer floor and was contained to a 20' x 5' area in the yard. All waste generated was containerized in the (1) IBC tote that was damaged which was then staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY, A PACKAGE SHIPPING FROM USA TO UNITED KINGDOM WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING. THE TOP OF THE BOX SHOWED SIGNS OF A DENT. THE OUTER BOX HAD AN IATA SHIPPERS DECLARATION WITH PROPER MARKS AND LABELS APPLIED. THE PACKAGE HAD SUCCESSFULLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS FOUND TWO X ONE GALLON METAL CANS OF PINEAPPLE EXPRESS AND GRAPE APE FLAVORED TERPENES. THE PINEAPPLE EXPRESS CAN WAS SLIGHTLY LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. THERE WERE NO VISIBLE SIGNS OF THE CLOSURE OR CAN BEING DAMAGED. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 1FE015, THE PERFUMER'S APPRENTICE, 170 TECHNOLOGY CIRCLE, SCOTTS VALLEY CA 95066.

item.title: Report X-2023070093
item.description:
Report X-2023070093

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-C. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 1 MINUTE A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION BY RESPONDER REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 PLASTIC 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE SIDE WALL AND BASE OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

THE LID ON THE METAL CAN HAD COME LOOSE DURING SHIPMENT, ALLOWING THE PAINT TO ESCAPE AND STAIN THE OUTER CARTON PLUS INNER CAN, ALL MATERIAL WAS PROCESSSED THROUGH THE DMP.

  • Description: On 05/14/2023, during the meal delivery phase of the flight, a passenger seated in 16E entered the forward (FWD) galley with a smoking e-cigarette. The device was hot to the touch. The passenger notified the Flight Attendant that the device would not stop smoking. The Flight Attendant proceeded to place the device in to a cup of water. The device was then placed in a fire containment bag with two large bottles of water. The flight continued to destination without further incident. No injuries were reported.

  • Description: On 05/24/2023 while on a return trip from Heidelberg Materials in Jordanville, O'brien Brickey was traveling west on Rt. 5S toward Utica. O'Brien pulled over immediately to check out the truck upon doing so noticed there was emulsion flowing out from what appeared to be several places. O'Brien immediately called his supervisor Derrick Paro who instructed him to call PERS and also NY DEC was notified. O'Brien was told by PERS that appropriate personnel would be dispatched for cleanup. The site was cleaned up and there is nothing further at this time.

  • Description: On 05/30/2023 at approximately 0200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 245617 at the station location in Burlington, reporting an undeclared flammable liquid spill. The shipment consisted of 1 plastic bottle of Arm-R-Seal, packed in a fiberboard box. The package raised suspicion because it displayed orientation arrows and made a liquid sound . The SDS found online by the agent classifies the commodity as UN 1263. The package was not prepared with the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork in accordance with IATA Regulations. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report I-2023050050
item.description:
Report I-2023050050

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-19T00:29:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-06
  • City: PORT ARTHUR
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: THE KANSAS CITY SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 00:30 on 1/6/2023, Kansas City Southern Railway's (KCS) Environmental & Hazmat Department was notified of an Ammonia odor in the KCS Port Arthur, TX rail yard. A railroad qualified response contractor was mobilized to investigate the odor. Upon arrival, responders Identified SHPX 221270 as the leaking tank car. Responders dawned proper PPE before ascending the car. Once on top of SHPX 221270 , responders found the A-side liquid valve less than tool tight and the A-side liquid valve plug was also less than tool tight. Estimated release was 3 gallons. The liquid valve and the plug were both secured tool tight. Once secure, the rail car was released back Into transportation. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a 'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.
